commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ib6aef74a409d728078c4c199806fda60447fb49c

commit_message:
[RBAC] Add share snapshot metadata tests

The tests validate policy of share snapshot metadata actions
for admin,member and reader users in a project scope.

'}, {'created': '2022-09-22 14:28:09.000000000', 'message': '[wip] swift_proxy: add memcache skip success/error stats for shard range.

Change-Id: Ib8be30d3969b4b4808664c43e94db53d10e6ef4c
'}, {'created': '2022-09-22 20:20:32.000000000', 'message': 'swift_proxy: add memcache skip success/error stats for shard range.

Change-Id: Ib8be30d3969b4b4808664c43e94db53d10e6ef4c
'}, {'created': '2022-09-29 05:14:05.000000000', 'message': "swift_proxy: add memcache skip success/error stats for shard range.

This patch will add more granularity to shard operation cache or
backend metrics, and then remove some of existing and duplicated
metrics.

Before this patch, related metrics are:
  1.shard_<op>.cache.[hit|miss|skip]
  2.shard_<op>.backend.<status_int>
where op is 'listing' or 'updating'.

With this patch, they are going to be:
  1.shard_<op>.cache.hit
    This is still same as previous.
  2.shard_<op>.cache.[miss|skip|force_skip|disabled|error].<status_int>
    Those are operations made to backend due to below reasons.
      miss: cache misses.
      skip: the selective skips per skip percentage config.
      force_skip: the request with 'x-newest' header.
      disabled: memcache is disabled.
      error: memcache connection error.
    For each kind of operation metrics, suffix <status_int> will
    count operations with different status. Then a sum of all
    status sub-metrics will the total metrics of that operation.

Change-Id: Ib8be30d3969b4b4808664c43e94db53d10e6ef4c
"}, {'created': '2022-09-30 05:58:42.000000000', 'message': "swift_proxy: add memcache skip success/error stats for shard range.

This patch will add more granularity to shard operation cache or
backend metrics, and then remove some of existing and duplicated
metrics.

Before this patch, related metrics are:
  1.shard_<op>.cache.[hit|miss|skip]
  2.shard_<op>.backend.<status_int>
where op is 'listing' or 'updating'.

With this patch, they are going to become:
  1.shard_<op>.infocache.hit
    cache hits with infocache.
  2.shard_<op>.cache.hit
    cache hits with memcache.
  3.shard_<op>.cache.[miss|skip|force_skip|disabled|error].<status_int>
    Those are operations made to backend due to below reasons.
      miss: cache misses.
      skip: the selective skips per skip percentage config.
      force_skip: the request with 'x-newest' header.
      disabled: memcache is disabled.
      error: memcache connection error.
    For each kind of operation metrics, suffix <status_int> will
    count operations with different status. Then a sum of all
    status sub-metrics will the total metrics of that operation.

UpgradeImpact
=============
Grafana dashboard will need updates to display those metrics correctly,
also infocache hits are newly added, please see above message for all
changes needed.

Change-Id: Ib8be30d3969b4b4808664c43e94db53d10e6ef4c

commit_message:
swift_proxy: add memcache skip success/error stats for shard range.

This patch will add more granularity to shard operation cache or
backend metrics, and then remove some of existing and duplicated
metrics.

Before this patch, related metrics are:
  1.shard_<op>.cache.[hit|miss|skip]
  2.shard_<op>.backend.<status_int>
where op is 'listing' or 'updating'.

With this patch, they are going to become:
  1.shard_<op>.infocache.hit
    cache hits with infocache.
  2.shard_<op>.cache.hit
    cache hits with memcache.
  3.shard_<op>.cache.[miss|skip|force_skip|disabled|error].<status_int>
    Those are operations made to backend due to below reasons.
      miss: cache misses.
      skip: the selective skips per skip percentage config.
      force_skip: the request with 'x-newest' header.
      disabled: memcache is disabled.
      error: memcache connection error.
    For each kind of operation metrics, suffix <status_int> will
    count operations with different status. Then a sum of all
    status sub-metrics will the total metrics of that operation.

UpgradeImpact
=============
Metrics dashboard will need updates to display those changed metrics
correctly, also infocache metrics are newly added, please see above
message for all changes needed.

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib8be30d3969b4b4808664c43e94db53d10e6ef4c

subject: Remove no longer used libvirt log hostpaths

Containerized libvirt and qemu write logs to
/var/log/containers/libvirt

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3dd4d9d1b39807f8ae1fd1e3ebe8434c7f599702
'}]
commit_message:
Remove no longer used libvirt log hostpaths

Containerized libvirt and qemu write logs to
/var/log/containers/libvirt

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3dd4d9d1b39807f8ae1fd1e3ebe8434c7f599702

commit_message:
NetApp: Use cluster client in non-vserver contexts

When share server is in error state in Manila and backend vserver has
not been created, there exist entries of share server and shares in the
database. Deletion of a share in such case causes the share to end up
in error_deleting state. In order to delete the share correctly,
we need to fix _get_vserver which should check vserver existence with
a client that is not tunneled to the possibly not existing vserver.

Closes-Bug: #1964592
Change-Id: I1f6b94a7e54403a559a5d77b4d93b939a40e76bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-25 22:06:57.000000000', 'message': 'Get ports directly instead of via loop

In order to get a list of available ports, the current implementation
of the form code in `project/instances/attach_interface` loops through
the available networks in the project and requests a list of ports for
each via the Neutron API. This implementation is O(N) in time with a
large prefactor (the time for a Neutron API call) where N is the
number of networks.

Instead of calling the Neutron API for each network this change uses
one call to the Neutron API to get the list of ports on all networks
and filters this list via a list comprehension. While this
implementation is still O(N) the prefactor is significantly smaller.

Closes-Bug: #1943639
Change-Id: I8fd32c3aad22d8ef7f57201f5144f6b2e357ef10
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f5d659d160d24d359992dda22fecb0db6b6f805)

commit_message:
Get ports directly instead of via loop

In order to get a list of available ports, the current implementation
of the form code in `project/instances/attach_interface` loops through
the available networks in the project and requests a list of ports for
each via the Neutron API. This implementation is O(N) in time with a
large prefactor (the time for a Neutron API call) where N is the
number of networks.

Instead of calling the Neutron API for each network this change uses
one call to the Neutron API to get the list of ports on all networks
and filters this list via a list comprehension. While this
implementation is still O(N) the prefactor is significantly smaller.

Includes some unit test fixes to workaround the fact that patch
6ac31e0 is not backported beyond Y.

Closes-Bug: #1943639
Change-Id: I8fd32c3aad22d8ef7f57201f5144f6b2e357ef10
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9f5d659d160d24d359992dda22fecb0db6b6f805)

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I4da8fd494f276747c3aa0edaa50bda7353686abc

commit_message:
Refactor memcache config and MemcacheRing loading

The loading and creation of the Memcache ring in the middleware is
rather interesting. It not only reads the config file, but also may
look for a `/etc/swift/memcache.conf`. Further, we are know are
looking at using the MemcacheRing client in more places.

So this patch moves the config reading from the middleware and
into a `load_memcache` helper method in swift/common/memcached.py.

Drive-by: cleanup unused stuff in middleware test module

Change-Id: I028722facfbe3ff8092b6bdcc931887a169cc49a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-20 12:08:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add legacy compute el8 role for FFUv3

FFUv3 (Train->Wallaby) and mixed-rhel stories require possibility to
run modular libvirt on el9 hypervisors and monolithic libvirt on el8.

Add ComputeEL8 to default role_data.yaml, which uses new service
OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirtLegacy to run monolithic libvirt on
computes that are supposed to stay on RHEL8.4 (el8) for some time.

Related: rhbz#2136163
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0476851066a5c3e22e09ff02ed4bb19a7eff71a7

It is not clear yet if we might need a new ComputeEL8 role, or not.
Create legacy service OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirtLegacy to run
monolithic libvirt on such computes that are supposed to stay on
RHEL8.4 (el8) for some time.

Related: rhbz#2136163
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0476851066a5c3e22e09ff02ed4bb19a7eff71a7

commit_message:
Add legacy monolithic libvirt service for FFUv3

FFUv3 (Train->Wallaby) and mixed-rhel stories require possibility to
run modular libvirt on el9 hypervisors and monolithic libvirt on el8.

It is not clear yet if we might need a new ComputeEL8 role, or not.
Create legacy service OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirtLegacy to run
monolithic libvirt on such computes that are supposed to stay on
RHEL8.4 (el8) for some time.

Related: rhbz#2136163
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0476851066a5c3e22e09ff02ed4bb19a7eff71a7

commit_message:
proxy: refactor error limiter to a class

This patch pulls the proxy's error limiting code into an ErrorLimiter
class that can be used to provide error limiting.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Oliver <matt@oliver.net.au>
Change-Id: Ie15d831278a55ffab156ddce04544317e451407d

commit_message:
Existing images update name, visibility etc

Dropped default values of min_disk and min_ram parameters because
it interferes with the update mechanism and glance uses those values
anyway [1], [2].

If the image is already present and visibility param is defined we
should check its visibility and correct it if needed. Added tests
to verify that both is_public and visibility can change the image.

If both name and id are specified for the image, we might want to
update the image name. This rely on fact that id pram is checked first.
Added rename tests to verify this.

For some reason if image object is used for the image update, 409
error produced and exception trown, but the change is in place. So
instead of image object, update query rely on the image.id

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/75051dd5a2cdeef2919ba2062714bde7502416ba/glance/db/simple/api.py#L226
[2] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/75051dd5a2cdeef2919ba2062714bde7502416ba/glance/domain/__init__.py#L125

Change-Id: I9ca6b78bec96b69e6946b65796f12314a1ec6ab4

revisions:

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I5308e80d926050e3acb89ae3e94c7b43559891c2
'}]
commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I5308e80d926050e3acb89ae3e94c7b43559891c2

commit_message:
Make virt_mkfs configurable with ext4 default

This means that we will have a configurable default for
all volume types and the new default will provide the
same value the current default_ephemeral_volume setting.

Change-Id: Ia2ac7318f1164a9015bdf9e7ce7d20a129e22af4
Closes-Bug: #1960231

commit_message:
Fix success_url parameter issue for Edit Snapshot

The "success_url" param is used when updating the project snapshot
[1] and it lacks sanitizing the input URL that allows an attacker to
redirect the user to another website. This patch update 'Updateview'
class to not use the "sucess_url" method.

Closes-bug: #1982676

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/snapshots/views.py#L109

Change-Id: Ied142440965b1a722e7a4dd1be3b1be3b3e1644b
(cherry picked from commit 79d139594290779b2f74ca894332aa7f2f7e4735)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-30 20:42:51.000000000', 'message': "Don't destroy existing backup by mistake on import

We're supposed to fail an import request for an already existing
backup, but the current code confuses an existing backup record with
one we created for the import, and during quota rollback, will
destroy either one.  Simplify the logic so that we check whether
there's an already existing backup first and bail without even
bothering to make an unnecessary reservation, hence leaving us nothing
to roll back or delete by mistake.

Also revise and add tests.

Closes-bug: #1965847
Change-Id: I3c0e365f5dc3c32975343f538c6029f02ac7c2b5
(cherry picked from commit 6386cbb0a0b6cbf05ce625c5b1b680f4259bde2e)
(cherry picked from commit 753c0224631e218c860e48722520e9ad384ca2f4)
(cherry picked from commit 332aa33404f53b39392df3fc37dddb85b5a2890c)
(cherry picked from commit 741d0ce546d3221329751fd024cade09088d6422)
(cherry picked from commit 70001254f6e9e9644e68f1c4bcd0465dfda5dedd)
(cherry picked from commit 407e24b5c85377eb952d73491ff3e06ddd2c6994)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't destroy existing backup by mistake on import

We're supposed to fail an import request for an already existing
backup, but the current code confuses an existing backup record with
one we created for the import, and during quota rollback, will
destroy either one.  Simplify the logic so that we check whether
there's an already existing backup first and bail without even
bothering to make an unnecessary reservation, hence leaving us nothing
to roll back or delete by mistake.

Also revise and add tests.

Closes-bug: #1965847
Change-Id: I3c0e365f5dc3c32975343f538c6029f02ac7c2b5
(cherry picked from commit 6386cbb0a0b6cbf05ce625c5b1b680f4259bde2e)
(cherry picked from commit 753c0224631e218c860e48722520e9ad384ca2f4)
(cherry picked from commit 332aa33404f53b39392df3fc37dddb85b5a2890c)
(cherry picked from commit 741d0ce546d3221329751fd024cade09088d6422)
(cherry picked from commit 70001254f6e9e9644e68f1c4bcd0465dfda5dedd)
(cherry picked from commit 407e24b5c85377eb952d73491ff3e06ddd2c6994)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 16:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/1.5.x

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/1.5.x branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I483291cc7e348fa374d77272ff7f05df555c7274
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/1.5.x

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/1.5.x branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I483291cc7e348fa374d77272ff7f05df555c7274

commit_message:
Create stable/zed for tripleo repos

After moving to independent release model, we did releases
for Xena and Yoga without stable branches. For Zed we're
creating stable/zed branch along with releases for all
relevant TripleO repos.

Change-Id: Id6fa1b598ee430a6b496cf4f315e5fb3e7a2df4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-16 19:25:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove netstat line (suse)

It breaks on Tumbleweed as VERSION is not used. We could fix this by
using VERSION_ID instead, however, support for Leap 15 was removed
with I762755024322afc6517adfb8ad79adfa3ec346cf

A better solution would be to replace the one occurence of netstat
with the iproute equivalent 'ss'

Change-Id: I84c441f54c5793fe94b50810cda25f9eacee8c7e
"}, {'created': '2022-10-21 17:57:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove netstat line (suse)

A better solution would be to replace the one occurence of netstat

Added validation tasks for listing external compute

It adds validate_edpm.yml playbook to list
external compute on the controller node.

commit_message:
Fix endpoint type in user_verify_admin_password

Endpoint type is hard-coded as public in this function.
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py#L466

Change-Id: I14aa1f1ee78f123bdbb6e3c4db314f96eec96f1b

commit_message:
Fix issue in extract image

The problem lays with the 'extract-image' script as
it is using lsblk commands to extract image's partition
(find out root/efi/boot, lines:100-102) but the output
is empty inside a container.

lsblk gives empty output for FSTYPE, LABEL, GUID..
the fix is to use blkid.

Closes-Bug: 1974350
Change-Id: I3b460c6dd9caa519c55327c5bd4b7e4585a8bd22

commit_message:
Switching netstat to ss in report

Probably should have happened a long time ago [1]. netstat doesn't
come out-of-the-box with some distributions these days.

[1] https://lwn.net/Articles/710533/

Change-Id: Idcd2099cca715837a3ad9bd595fa8f08531ef863

[{'created': '2022-10-16 19:25:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix initial python/venv dependencies

If you're running 'ansible-playbook -i inventory/target install.yaml'
install python3-pip on the system as early as possible.

We need to set ansible_python_interpreter to the system, because some

commit_message:
Fix initial python/venv dependencies

If you're running 'ansible-playbook -i inventory/target install.yaml'
install python3-pip on the system as early as possible.

We need to set ansible_python_interpreter to the system, because some
roles set it to {{ bifrost_venv_dir }}/bin/python3, which doesn't
necessarily exist at this moment.

We can now create a venv, and override ansible_python_interpreter

Change-Id: Iee5125c61151f01538371f4140cd5321ab509bba

commit_message:
Spread OVN metadata agent heartbeat response in time

To avoid mass response of OVN metadata agents on
heartbeat update - event on OVN Southbound
SB_Global table nb_cfg entry increment, this patch postpone
Chassis/Chassis_Private table update for random number
of seconds in range of ( cfg.CONF.agent_down_time // 2 ).

Related-Bug: #1991817
Change-Id: I6373a3c213b24ec957e4d2ea7fc42524517d10d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-21 13:00:58.000000000', 'message': '[keystone] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I1c6d6a3aaf1ffc60b5bae4a4fb019c61647fe21a
'}]

commit_message:
Use ingress-public in wsgi configuration

To expose ingress paths, use ingress-public
instead of ingress-internal in wsgi
configuration file

Add placement services to test bundle

[{'created': '2022-10-31 15:08:42.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe"

This reverts commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8.

Reason for revert: It breaks Neutron server to start if OVN
                   database is large. Also Neutron server shouldn't
                   be configuring other services, it should be done
                   rather by an installer.

Change-Id: Ia1dc8072ecec1c019dd02039dadd78d544dbd843
(cherry picked from commit 30d1a40c508386905b12c43be1891ce503a8b634)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe"

This reverts commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8.

Reason for revert: It breaks Neutron server to start if OVN
                   database is large. Also Neutron server shouldn't
                   be configuring other services, it should be done
                   rather by an installer.

Change-Id: Ia1dc8072ecec1c019dd02039dadd78d544dbd843
(cherry picked from commit 30d1a40c508386905b12c43be1891ce503a8b634)

api: extend evacuate instance to support target state

Start to v2.94 any evacuated instances will be stopped a destination

Implements: bp/allowing-target-state-for-evacuate
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: I141b6f057cc4eb9c541c2bc6eddae27270ede08d

messages: [{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2022-10-21 13:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-10-24 00:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2022-10-24 08:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2022-11-01 05:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-21 13:06:22.000000000', 'message': '[storlets] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Ic9a8faea91b1778f2aa66bd48b858fc7f018af09
'}]
commit_message:
[storlets] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Ic9a8faea91b1778f2aa66bd48b858fc7f018af09

commit_message:
Release trove for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to trove since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 15.0.0..3b846ad2
3b846ad2 Fix trove guest agent logrotate
f9059488 Run reset master when setting up mysql replicas
f0315edf Add periodic task to remove postgres archived wal files
4f6300cd Fix getting config option value for database
67db4d40 Fix rebuild instances in replication cluster
0b8be927 Keep user defined configuration after resizing instance
ae5904f9 Add package iptables-persistent inside guest instance
a401b761 Use bridge network for db container
8849ceda Fix backup using customized container image registry
c7bbcf43 Add float types to load_items to support configuration parameters of float type
698c715a Fix periodic public image job
ad3d3b7b Fix check_subnet_router filters
d98cd153 Change settings for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I156d0257dba4883e9106690d0dc27993ad911db6

commit_message:
[masakari] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I6c7134215e06ec3099b02813e11d09cf8a0861e3

commit_message:
Release adjutant for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to adjutant since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.0.0..d1643a7
d1643a7 Fix an issue with Adjutant's Invite process not checking inherited roles
1ef32b7 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
8861ab9 Update .gitreview for stable/wallaby
95ae807 Change default volume API to v3
c4bf791 Update formatting because of black version

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I088e735b3410e56b11c1859d091eaa3df854055f

commit_message:
[zun] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Ic0df7d3234df4bdae6549b5ddd1c8ac2f4cb988b

commit_message:
Drop python-six

This charm doesn't need to support python 2.x anymore, and python-six
was dropped from the Ubuntu Archive on Kinetic (22.10)

Change-Id: Ibd7d373305b608ff0349986d17ecba7f9dfaeb3c
Closes-Bug: #1995285

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-21 13:01:43.000000000', 'message': '[kuryr] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I9ba2832dfa41c883e74e9ada65d678a220d0e82d
'}]
commit_message:
[kuryr] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I9ba2832dfa41c883e74e9ada65d678a220d0e82d

'}]
commit_message:
Handle "no RAM info was set" migration case

This handles the case where the live migration monitoring thread may
race and call jobStats() after the migration has completed resulting in
the following error:

    libvirt.libvirtError: internal error: migration was active, but no
    RAM info was set

Closes-Bug: #1982284
Change-Id: I77fdfa9cffbd44b2889f49f266b2582bcc6a4267
(cherry picked from commit 9fea934c71d3c2fa7fdd80c67d94e18466c5cf9a)
(cherry picked from commit 00396fa9396324780c09161ed57a86b7e458c26f)

subject: Only return hacluster nodes from list_nodes()
messages: [{'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2022-11-02 12:27:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 12:27:08.000000000', 'message': "Only return hacluster nodes from list_nodes()

list_nodes() recently had some changes to run 'crm node show'
in jammy+ instead of 'crm node status'. The difference is that
'crm node show' returns the pacemaker-remote nodes in addition
 to the hacluster nodes. This change limits the nodes returned
by list_nodes() to the hacluster nodes (ie. the nodes that
have a node ID).

Closes-Bug: #1995295
Change-Id: Ia405d4270f56c949f79167f8b75c1304b598b918
(cherry picked from commit a03b0b2a87e8667da2f43c4e5f827d9ff8843307)
"}]
commit_message:
Only return hacluster nodes from list_nodes()

list_nodes() recently had some changes to run 'crm node show'
in jammy+ instead of 'crm node status'. The difference is that
'crm node show' returns the pacemaker-remote nodes in addition
 to the hacluster nodes. This change limits the nodes returned
by list_nodes() to the hacluster nodes (ie. the nodes that
have a node ID).

Closes-Bug: #1995295
Change-Id: Ia405d4270f56c949f79167f8b75c1304b598b918
(cherry picked from commit a03b0b2a87e8667da2f43c4e5f827d9ff8843307)

subject: Update 'crm node show' parsing to trim ': member'
messages: [{'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2022-10-26 19:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2022-10-27 09:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2022-11-02 14:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-26 19:20:51.000000000', 'message': "Update 'crm node show' parsing to trim ': member'

The command 'crm node show' is used on jammy to retrieve the list of
nodes defined in a cluster. The output for nodes includes ': member'
which breaks ensuing commands that are using list_nodes() output.

For example:
juju-3f6cb6-zaza-4135aa8b2509-8.project.serverstack: member

This change trims everything including and after the ':' from the
output.

Closes-Bug: #1994160
Change-Id: I54a4f854f3e293503ec97d99a49b6dc51ee50c87
(cherry picked from commit f73ca4d52fdc530531366d65e412a17877c88c63)
"}]
commit_message:
Update 'crm node show' parsing to trim ': member'

The command 'crm node show' is used on jammy to retrieve the list of
nodes defined in a cluster. The output for nodes includes ': member'
which breaks ensuing commands that are using list_nodes() output.

For example:
juju-3f6cb6-zaza-4135aa8b2509-8.project.serverstack: member

This change trims everything including and after the ':' from the
output.

Closes-Bug: #1994160
Change-Id: I54a4f854f3e293503ec97d99a49b6dc51ee50c87
(cherry picked from commit f73ca4d52fdc530531366d65e412a17877c88c63)

commit_message:
Strictly follow placement allocation during PCI claim

The current PCI claim logic only ensures that the PCI devices are
allocated from the pools that are also used by the placement allocation.
But it does not make sure that the correct amount of device is consumed
from the correct pool. This could lead to a situation where the
placement allocation used one dev from RP1 and two devs from RP2 while
the PCI claim did the opposite and allocated two devs from the pool
mapped to RP1 and one from the other.

This patch fixes the logic in the stats module to not only consider the
pools but also consider the amount of devices based on the placement
allocation (candidate).

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: Ibc8cacc85a09ffc2985c1eb637ae35014b8e595e

commit_message:
Add OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINT_TYPE config opt

The [1] changed the previous behavior of Horizon by
changing the hardcoded internal endpoint type to using
OPENSTACK_ENDPOINT_TYPE so it's no longer possible to use
internal endpoint type for Keystone but public for others.

This adds the OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_ENDPOINT_TYPE config opt
to set the endpoint type for Keystone when grabbing it from
the service catalog.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/730781

Change-Id: I8438bedaf7cead452fc499e484d23690b48894d9

[{'created': '2022-11-02 12:13:09.000000000', 'message': 'Raise an exc if no VIP/backend is available

When deploying Manila CephFS NFS with cephadm,
the manila share service fails to start with the error
"Backend cephfsnfs supports neither IPv4 nor IPv6".

This happens because the NFS Ganesha daemon fails
to start for some reason and therefore the driver never
gets the location of the NFS Ganesha service
that will be used as the backend.

We should raise an error in this case with more information
about the failure.

This change adds this to the NFSClusterProtocol helper.

Closes-Bug: #1990150

Change-Id: Ic74c6c9d9770974848ec9dfb6d2225ce9b3bcb52
(cherry picked from commit 8276fa3c88f17744d65f53124b91b26c4c62d2d0)
'}]
commit_message:
Raise an exc if no VIP/backend is available

When deploying Manila CephFS NFS with cephadm,
the manila share service fails to start with the error
"Backend cephfsnfs supports neither IPv4 nor IPv6".

This happens because the NFS Ganesha daemon fails
to start for some reason and therefore the driver never
gets the location of the NFS Ganesha service
that will be used as the backend.

We should raise an error in this case with more information
about the failure.

This change adds this to the NFSClusterProtocol helper.

Closes-Bug: #1990150

Change-Id: Ic74c6c9d9770974848ec9dfb6d2225ce9b3bcb52
(cherry picked from commit 8276fa3c88f17744d65f53124b91b26c4c62d2d0)

commit_message:
Reproduce PCI pool filtering bug

PCI pool filtering only follow the allocation candidate to select which
PCI pool can be used but does not consider how much devices should be
consumed from which pool.

Change-Id: I97851180b7af275ea7e4c175be6056130906af87

commit_message:
[freezer] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Ib811f53b925e726a73d45968c177d181b4b62b9d

Since [1], OVN allows only one physical network per bridge,
same as other ML2 plugins (OVS, Linux Bridge). The rule "one
network, one bridge" is present in OVN too.

This patch fixes a small leftover in the ML2/OVN code.

(cherry picked from commit 229d798a45c964783551cd61d7031698d452f72a)

'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Allow only one physical network per bridge

Since [1], OVN allows only one physical network per bridge,
same as other ML2 plugins (OVS, Linux Bridge). The rule "one
network, one bridge" is present in OVN too.

This patch fixes a small leftover in the ML2/OVN code.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/823568

(cherry picked from commit 229d798a45c964783551cd61d7031698d452f72a)

Related-Bug: #1956476
Change-Id: I955f2430ad1d817966ac49f33741f1d4452d1f76

commit_message:
Move mtu update request into ovsdb transaction

os-vif currently set the requested mtu as part of separate request
to the port add command. As a result the port is initially created
with mbufer pool for the jumboframe size, which results in an
error in openvswitch-vswitch logs.

This change moves the mtu update request into ovsdb transaction.

Closes-Bug: #1959586
Change-Id: I1acd74efc100c6f949b5c72525c455aebfa2c50e

commit_message:
libvirt: add optional cpu-model configuration

Some deployment may have the desir for guests running on host to
expose a certain set of capabilities.

This change gives to operator ability to set a model for guests
deployed. It's especially useful for deployment running different host
CPUs model.

Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: I74da907182490311e8a79197ce73fddbfe4f7799

commit_message:
Revert "[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe"

This reverts commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8.

Reason for revert: It breaks Neutron server to start if OVN
                   database is large. Also Neutron server shouldn't
                   be configuring other services, it should be done
                   rather by an installer.

Change-Id: Ia1dc8072ecec1c019dd02039dadd78d544dbd843
(cherry picked from commit 30d1a40c508386905b12c43be1891ce503a8b634)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-28 13:07:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure OVN-LB is properly configured upon LS removal from LR

If an ovn-lb is created (VIP and members) in a LS (neutron network)
that has 2 subnets (IPv4 + IPv6), and this LS is connected to a LR,
removing the LS from the LR leads to the removal of the ovn-lb from
the LS and consequently to remove it from the OVN SB DB as it is not
associated to any datapath

This is a problem on the _find_ls_for_lr function that looks for
all the LR ports, and get the network name from them, therefore,
even though the port for the LS got deleted, there is still another
port from the other subnet pointing to the same network (LS), which
is the culprit to delete the ovn-lb from that LS.

With this patch, the VIP IP version is consider so that the router
ports that belongs to the other subnet are not considered and the
ovn-lb is not therefore removed from the LS.

(manually cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)

Closes-Bug: #1992363
Change-Id: I7b6dd9a31020d942d391726662e9b5ed9d76dc1f
(cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)
'}, {'created': '2022-10-31 07:38:41.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure OVN-LB is properly configured upon LS removal from LR

If an ovn-lb is created (VIP and members) in a LS (neutron network)
that has 2 subnets (IPv4 + IPv6), and this LS is connected to a LR,
removing the LS from the LR leads to the removal of the ovn-lb from
the LS and consequently to remove it from the OVN SB DB as it is not
associated to any datapath

This is a problem on the _find_ls_for_lr function that looks for
all the LR ports, and get the network name from them, therefore,
even though the port for the LS got deleted, there is still another
port from the other subnet pointing to the same network (LS), which
is the culprit to delete the ovn-lb from that LS.

With this patch, the VIP IP version is consider so that the router
ports that belongs to the other subnet are not considered and the
ovn-lb is not therefore removed from the LS.

(manually cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)

Closes-Bug: #1992363
Change-Id: I7b6dd9a31020d942d391726662e9b5ed9d76dc1f
(cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure OVN-LB is properly configured upon LS removal from LR

If an ovn-lb is created (VIP and members) in a LS (neutron network)
that has 2 subnets (IPv4 + IPv6), and this LS is connected to a LR,
removing the LS from the LR leads to the removal of the ovn-lb from
the LS and consequently to remove it from the OVN SB DB as it is not
associated to any datapath

This is a problem on the _find_ls_for_lr function that looks for
all the LR ports, and get the network name from them, therefore,
even though the port for the LS got deleted, there is still another
port from the other subnet pointing to the same network (LS), which
is the culprit to delete the ovn-lb from that LS.

With this patch, the VIP IP version is consider so that the router
ports that belongs to the other subnet are not considered and the
ovn-lb is not therefore removed from the LS.

(manually cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)

Closes-Bug: #1992363
Change-Id: I7b6dd9a31020d942d391726662e9b5ed9d76dc1f
(cherry picked from commit 512b2c83b567eaecdfa2d96ecc1facc3723b4f55)

commit_message:
Fix Create From Snapshot with Server Limits

Share Server limits must be ignored in case the new share is
from a snapshot and same host as the parent, since they must
be in the same server.

Closes-bug: #1918845
Change-Id: I1c611f4a7f3590b571f75ceca17c2fc3d8f3ad7a
(cherry picked from commit 3bd8fe3cfe5f9e9bffb18f0a6ae669bc83c1c665)

commit_message:
Update multi-inventory merging details

Describe the target inventories directory creation and
inventories generation specifics for Wallaby and trunk.

Unify ansible commands to use unified inventories directory
so that ansible can merge it or consume a merged inventory
produced with deprecated tripleo-ansible-inventory tool.

Change-Id: I1f46cb6db13d73382b03b4b60433cacfe5c76f34
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-22 13:43:23.000000000', 'message': 'Run virtqemud with umask 0027

Virtqemud container requires umask 0027 as libvirt/qemu dynamic
permissions should be restricted to not create VM files world readable.

commit_message:
Run virtqemud with umask 0027

Virtqemud container requires umask 0027 as libvirt/qemu dynamic
permissions should be restricted to not create VM files world readable.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/858930
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2bdc9c96cfce3df529229f4194dc816fa798658d

commit_message:
[WIP] add unix socket notifcation driver

This change is part of
bp/unix-socket-oslo-messaging-notifcations-driver

In this patch we introduce a basic notificaiton
driver which will serialise data as json over a
local unix socket.

Change-Id: Icaef5c9c0410dcdd1fe8bf6b25ffe6884b174d60

commit_message:
Adding dns.nameservers option in tempest

Designate tests now requires at least one nameserver in tempest
dns.nameservers option [1], this patch add it in order to make the test
passes.

1 - https://github.com/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/commit/6c251b44c57f8d08d45468ef00a5c4d53a9c923b

Closes-Bug: #1995169
Change-Id: I6ddd0e3ab6acbeefe957d52482c59577af9e1658

[{'created': '2022-06-18 11:37:42.000000000', 'message': 'Update Availability zone doc page

Availability zone doc page [1] mentioned that server moving
operation (evacuate/live-migrate) request can force target host
and bypass scheduler.

This support of forcing target host for evacuate/live-migrate
request was removed in [2].

This change updates the doc page to remove references of forcing
target host for evacuate/live-migrate.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html#implications-for-moving-servers
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:bp%252Fremove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate

Closes-Bug: #1947421
Change-Id: Iaf989ccbde49a8c3735d260b2dd4a319bc77caf8

commit_message:
Update Availability zone doc page

Availability zone doc page [1] mentioned that server moving
operation (evacuate/live-migrate) request can force target host
and bypass scheduler.

This support of forcing target host for evacuate/live-migrate
request was removed in [2].

This change updates the doc page by mentioning that it was possible
to force a host with older API microversion and how to use it, if
user wants to force target host for evacuate/live-migrate.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/availability-zones.html#implications-for-moving-servers
[2] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:bp%252Fremove-force-flag-from-live-migrate-and-evacuate

Closes-Bug: #1947421
Change-Id: Iaf989ccbde49a8c3735d260b2dd4a319bc77caf8

commit_message:
Add new vif type linkvirt_ovs

VIF type VIF_TYPE_LV_OVS used for external Neutron ML2
and OS-VIF plugin for Napatech LinkVirtualization OVS

Plugin link: https://github.com/napatech/linkvirt-ovs-openstack-plugin
Nova spec: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova-specs/+/859290

Change-Id: Id8b96ebdfa55dccb657c4e76b1948e096ce597a8

subject: [OVN] Allow only one physical network per bridge
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 11:36:57.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Allow only one physical network per bridge

Since [1], OVN allows only one physical network per bridge,
same as other ML2 plugins (OVS, Linux Bridge). The rule "one
network, one bridge" is present in OVN too.

This patch fixes a small leftover in the ML2/OVN code.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/823568

Related-Bug: #1956476
Change-Id: I955f2430ad1d817966ac49f33741f1d4452d1f76

commit_message:
[OVN] Allow only one physical network per bridge

Since [1], OVN allows only one physical network per bridge,
same as other ML2 plugins (OVS, Linux Bridge). The rule "one
network, one bridge" is present in OVN too.

This patch fixes a small leftover in the ML2/OVN code.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/823568

Related-Bug: #1956476
Change-Id: I955f2430ad1d817966ac49f33741f1d4452d1f76

(cherry picked from commit 229d798a45c964783551cd61d7031698d452f72a)
Change-Id: I064f777dd9e27fd929161d8aa0267c41c7ab43c2

subject: dhcp: support multiple segmentations per network

[{'created': '2022-05-04 07:07:57.000000000', 'message': 'dhcp: support multiple segmentations per network

This change makes the DHPC agent to handle multiple segmentation per
network.

For each segmentation a DHCP Process will be started, this has the
benefit to keep the current logic of building a DHCP service per
network domain.

Partial-Bug: #1764738

commit_message:
dhcp: support multiple segmentations per network

This change makes the DHPC agent to handle multiple segmentation per
network.

For each segmentation a DHCP Process will be started, this has the
benefit to keep the current logic of building a DHCP service per
network domain.

Partial-Bug: #1956435
Partial-Bug: #1764738
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: I88264ce2303cbaed983d437203232bd1459d58b2

Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this

commit_message:
[kolla] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I7ad39a82dd2ebad62af4e898ed4294e141349b8a

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-09 18:10:47.000000000', 'message': 'Include job duration in OpenSearch

TripleO CI team uses Zuul's "duration" field to make statistics,
how long particular job takes place.
Adding this field allows TripleO CI team to stop parsing ZUUL API,
and retrieve necessary information from OpenSearch.

Change-Id: Iab5b9570abd42b5ca9b39023722360f9813bb556
'}]
commit_message:
Include job duration in OpenSearch

TripleO CI team uses Zuul's "duration" field to make statistics,
how long particular job takes place.
Adding this field allows TripleO CI team to stop parsing ZUUL API,
and retrieve necessary information from OpenSearch.

Change-Id: Iab5b9570abd42b5ca9b39023722360f9813bb556

commit_message:
Updates for zed stable branch creation

- Set default branch for git review/gerrit to stable/zed
- Switch tests to stable.
- Switch to using stable charm-helpers branch.
- Switch to using stable charm.openstack branch.
- Switch to using stable zaza, zaza-openstack-tests
  branch
- (reactive charms) Add build.lock file
- (classic charms) make sync
- (reactive: not reactive plugin): lock charm-tools < 3.1
- (reactive: with reactive plugin): lock charm snap to 3.x/stable

Change-Id: Ibd5b91d89c5930a4718a057c0ff9feaec43937ce

commit_message:
Add / as forward proxy

Currently /<ingress> is added as forward proxy
in apache forwarder configuration. However the
internal/admin endpoints uses <IP:port>/ with
no <ingress> and so the request is not forwarded
to glance-api.
This patch adds / as well as forward proxy.

Change-Id: I53a297b1dc5e08d227fe3077accfe1513f96f082

subject: setuptools: Disable auto discovery
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-11-02 09:06:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-11-02 09:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-11-02 10:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 09:06:17.000000000', 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I459ac9da80967dbba08acccfd7b068e4910c3164
(cherry picked from commit e7cefc1ae06ba8db5c04ad84df403edd1435683e)
"}, {'created': '2022-11-02 09:13:54.000000000', 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I459ac9da80967dbba08acccfd7b068e4910c3164
(cherry picked from commit e7cefc1ae06ba8db5c04ad84df403edd1435683e)
"}]
commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I459ac9da80967dbba08acccfd7b068e4910c3164
(cherry picked from commit e7cefc1ae06ba8db5c04ad84df403edd1435683e)

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I70e28e2eb7a10c2a8d212ad67f2de723f4292c39
(cherry picked from commit 079d6f48b63cdbc1927465a0c2e5325fd4161a14)

[{'created': '2022-11-02 09:09:16.000000000', 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icb661b0cfe8887c8eb20560839868f334bc22fd8
(cherry picked from commit 5fb0ca4dc9cc7d9fa81601f43953cb43fa7e03e6)

setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~

~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~

~~~

~~~

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

[{'created': '2022-11-02 09:04:16.000000000', 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9767330a94f2406a6e76be0f7ce3886478bce3e5
(cherry picked from commit 58f113cba14ffb94094521a7ef6d5fde6fceb055)

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9767330a94f2406a6e76be0f7ce3886478bce3e5
(cherry picked from commit 58f113cba14ffb94094521a7ef6d5fde6fceb055)

~~~

to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

[{'created': '2021-11-29 04:20:34.000000000', 'message': 'Gnocchi: Fix how CORS middleware is enabled

The [api] middleware parameter is no longer avalable since Gnocchi
2.0.0[1], and api-paste.ini should be modified to enable additional
middleware.
This change fixes the outdated method to enable the CORS middleware,
which is not enabled by default.

commit_message:
Gnocchi: Remove ineffective [api] middleware

The [api] middleware parameter is no longer avalable since Gnocchi
2.0.0[1], and CORS middleware is enabled without modifying pipeline
since Gnocchi 2.2.0[2].

[1] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/7e56cd671282c34f5f8c0efc215e2f1c77fe38a2
[2] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/db0eb3fdc14d9cd5f6022d49933d03a4d4ccef5e

Closes-Bug: #1952565
Change-Id: I9d69579a642b198b973383abe392fae09531182b

subject: Configure path from ingress-public data
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 10:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'Configure path from ingress-public data

As the public ingress relation is the only required ingress
relation ensure that the path base WSGI script alias is
enabled when the public ingress relation is present rather
than the internal ingress relation which is optional.

Change-Id: I7826117a25ee0019cbc8b10cec5752c0795888c7
'}]
commit_message:
Configure path from ingress-public data

As the public ingress relation is the only required ingress
relation ensure that the path base WSGI script alias is
enabled when the public ingress relation is present rather
than the internal ingress relation which is optional.

Change-Id: I7826117a25ee0019cbc8b10cec5752c0795888c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 04:17:50.000000000', 'message': 'Restore only diff data in backup chunked driver

Backup restoring will write all backup data to the target
volume. However, it may make the target lose its sparsity
that consuming too much space.

Only different data is needed to be written. Skipping over the
same data will not break data consistency but may keep the
sparsity.

Before restoring a chunk, read the chunk data from the target
volume first and calculate the sha256 value of each block. Only
the blocks with different sha256 value (between the backup and
the target) will be written. The rest will be skipped over.

Add a configuration item to enable it (default is False)
  backup_restore_only_diff_blocks = False/True

Change-Id: I58a97dba563a138d10db81bbac1849a61840ba26
'}]
commit_message:
Restore only diff data in backup chunked driver

Backup restoring will write all backup data to the target
volume. However, it may make the target lose its sparsity
that consuming too much space.

Only different data is needed to be written. Skipping over the
same data will not break data consistency but may keep the
sparsity.

Before restoring a chunk, read the chunk data from the target
volume first and calculate the sha256 value of each block. Only
the blocks with different sha256 value (between the backup and
the target) will be written. The rest will be skipped over.

Add a configuration item to enable it (default is False)
  backup_restore_only_diff_blocks = False/True

Change-Id: I58a97dba563a138d10db81bbac1849a61840ba26

commit_message:
Restore into sparse volumes

We take the approach to detect zero data when restoring and not
writing it out to the volume. This works exactly as expected
when restoring into Linux LVM volumes and into Ceph RBD volumes.

Change-Id: I54b81a568a01af44e3f74bcac55e823cdae9bfbf

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-01 14:40:11.000000000', 'message': "Only return hacluster nodes from list_nodes()

list_nodes() recently had some changes to run 'crm node show'
in jammy+ instead of 'crm node status'. The difference is that
'crm node show' returns the pacemaker-remote nodes in addition
 to the hacluster nodes. This change limits the nodes returned
by list_nodes() to the hacluster nodes (ie. the nodes that
have a node ID).

Closes-Bug: #1995295
Change-Id: Ia405d4270f56c949f79167f8b75c1304b598b918
"}]
commit_message:
Only return hacluster nodes from list_nodes()

list_nodes() recently had some changes to run 'crm node show'
in jammy+ instead of 'crm node status'. The difference is that
'crm node show' returns the pacemaker-remote nodes in addition
 to the hacluster nodes. This change limits the nodes returned
by list_nodes() to the hacluster nodes (ie. the nodes that
have a node ID).

Closes-Bug: #1995295
Change-Id: Ia405d4270f56c949f79167f8b75c1304b598b918

The correct option to use is valid_interfaces [1], not os_endpoint_type.
The os_endpoint_type option was removed in Train.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/wallaby/configuration/sample-config.html

commit_message:
Fix ironic interface option for ironic-inspector

The correct option to use is valid_interfaces [1], not os_endpoint_type.
The os_endpoint_type option was removed in Train.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic-inspector/wallaby/configuration/sample-config.html

Change-Id: I3906d7b9a2bebfe5c323cba5f80add3e932468c8
Closes-Bug: #1995246
Related-Bug: #1990675

An important fix was included in the Zed branch, so a new release
is needed to make that fix available.

git log --oneline --no-merges 4.1.0..b25443d
b25443d (origin/stable/zed) Respect OS_CACERT when using Manila OSC plugin
3a8e86e Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Change-Id: Ie9f228ce04dd07dba6405041d8d37d7683deaeff
'}]
commit_message:
[python-manilaclient] New release for zed

An important fix was included in the Zed branch, so a new release
is needed to make that fix available.

git log --oneline --no-merges 4.1.0..b25443d
b25443d (origin/stable/zed) Respect OS_CACERT when using Manila OSC plugin
3a8e86e Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed
3291207 Update .gitreview for stable/zed

Change-Id: Ie9f228ce04dd07dba6405041d8d37d7683deaeff

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-31 05:21:11.000000000', 'message': 'Immediately fail when parsing a YAML file fails

... instead of continuing the process and fail later when accessing
the uninitialized variable.

Change-Id: I999419c986bb76e9ecb5fff733c7110baf611d89
'}, {'created': '2022-10-31 05:49:04.000000000', 'message': 'Check NodePortMap before checking DeployedServerPortMap

The DeployedServerPortMap parameter was already deprecated[1] in favor
of the new NodePortMap. This change fixes the ceph_spec_boostrap module
so that it looks up the new parameter.

This change includes the following small improvements.
 - Show more clear message in case the data file has invalid YAML
   format
 - Show explicit error when parameter_defaults section is missing
 - Include only host IPs in ctlplane network, because vips and
   IPs in the other networks are not used

[1] 26be3179905c7751812aa10a0af9f56e58e7ef08

Change-Id: I999419c986bb76e9ecb5fff733c7110baf611d89
'}, {'created': '2022-10-31 06:57:25.000000000', 'message': 'Check NodePortMap before checking DeployedServerPortMap

The DeployedServerPortMap parameter was already deprecated[1] in favor
of the new NodePortMap. This change fixes the ceph_spec_boostrap module
so that it looks up the new parameter.

This change includes the following small improvements.
 - Show more clear message in case the data file has invalid YAML
   format
 - Show explicit error when parameter_defaults section is missing
 - Include only host IPs in ctlplane network, because vips and
   IPs in the other networks are not used

[1] 26be3179905c7751812aa10a0af9f56e58e7ef08

Change-Id: I999419c986bb76e9ecb5fff733c7110baf611d89

commit_message:
Hitachi: add GAD volume support

This patch adds GAD volume support for Hitachi VSP driver.

New properties will be added in configuration:
hbsd:topology sets to "active_active_mirror_volume" would specify
a GAD volume.
hitachi_mirror_xxx parameters would specify a secondary storage
for GAD volume.

Implements: blueprint hitachi-gad-support
Change-Id: I4543cd036897b4db8b04011b808dd5af34439153

[{'created': '2022-09-19 05:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tls-e CA cert declaration for FRR

When using the OVN FRR Ansible role, we currently default to
/etc/ipa/ca.crt. We should instead use the value defined by the
user in InternalTLSCAFile parameter.

This change defines the relevant Ansible variables when the role
is called:
  tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_ca_cert

Change-Id: I3ac3f21fa8c460e56e02be940b237cb0737583f5
'}, {'created': '2022-10-12 01:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tls-e CA cert declaration for FRR

When using the OVN FRR Ansible role, we currently default to
/etc/ipa/ca.crt. We should instead use the value defined by the
user in InternalTLSCAFile parameter.

This change defines the relevant Ansible variables when the role
is called:
  tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_ca_cert

Change-Id: I3ac3f21fa8c460e56e02be940b237cb0737583f5
(cherry picked from commit 3fda88c3aa5bd7a06d44f6f07cce72ceffac1234)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tls-e CA cert declaration for FRR

When using the OVN FRR Ansible role, we currently default to
/etc/ipa/ca.crt. We should instead use the value defined by the
user in InternalTLSCAFile parameter.

This change defines the relevant Ansible variables when the role
is called:
  tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_ca_cert

Change-Id: I3ac3f21fa8c460e56e02be940b237cb0737583f5
(cherry picked from commit 3fda88c3aa5bd7a06d44f6f07cce72ceffac1234)

commit_message:
Update config-download documentation

With Ephemeral Heat, the config-download process now looks
substantially different. This change updates the config-download
documentation to represent the latest workflow with Ephemeral Heat.

Change-Id: Ief79972d7305640fb480990ba94faa33a179c5e5

commit_message:
puppet-pacemaker: Enable highavailability repository

The puppet-pacemaker module requires a few packages from the high-
availability repository in its unit tests. This ensures the repository
is enabled before attempting to install its dependencies, so that
we can leverage the common helper/playbook/job.

Change-Id: Id78360efb4a79be7c39fdf072c254d4bd2818d0a

commit_message:
Octavia: Remove unnecessary neutronclient package

The neutron cli is no longer used since the dependent patch was merged.
Also CentOS/RHEL 7 is no longer supported so the logic for that old
OS version can be removed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/845846
Change-Id: I018811a07283644ae7445c92ced958542f97b0e4
(cherry picked from commit ac5b16012a4f3164c8c607f9960961c7c1810c2e)

[{'created': '2022-10-05 06:43:01.000000000', 'message': "Support role specific ContainerImagePrepare

This implements partial support for overriding the ContainerImaePrepare
parameter for individual roles, so that users can use different set
of images for each role.

example:
parameter_defaults:
  ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos9
        ...
  ComputeEl8ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos8
        ...

This change ensures that container image prepare process, which is
executed by external tasks, pulls container images according to these
layer definitions so that the required container images are downloaded
and pushed to the undercloud image-server during deployment.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/851689
Change-Id: I7c96d7d0f23fd999e76b417f456ac6a2764c4a3e
(cherry picked from commit 3dd4107b13c27198947995bb8c94710b527aff95)

commit_message:
Support role specific ContainerImagePrepare

This implements partial support for overriding the ContainerImaePrepare
parameter for individual roles, so that users can use different set
of images for each role.

example:
parameter_defaults:
  ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos9
        ...
  ComputeEl8ContainerImagePrepare:
    - push_destination: true
      set:
        name_prefix: openstack-
        name_suffix: ''
        namespace: quay.io/repository/tripleowallabycentos8
        ...

This change ensures that container image prepare process, which is
executed by external tasks, pulls container images according to these
layer definitions so that the required container images are downloaded
and pushed to the undercloud image-server during deployment.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/851689
Change-Id: I7c96d7d0f23fd999e76b417f456ac6a2764c4a3e
(cherry picked from commit 3dd4107b13c27198947995bb8c94710b527aff95)

commit_message:
Use puppet-openstack_spec_helper

This change replaces a few core files such as spec_helper by the common
implementation in puppet-openstack_spec_helper, so that we don't need
to maintain the different implementation in this repository. This
allows us to fix the broken library installation in CentOS 9 Stream.

Because of this change, acceptance tests now uses litmus instead of
beaker, following the transition in the Puppet OpenStack project. Note
the acceptance tests are not actually used in CI. We probably want to
add litmus jobs to run these tests but these are left as a future work
now.

Also, fixed the manifests to adapt to a few more lint plugins enabled.
The example manifests are updated, to avoid failure in
the check_absolute_classname lint plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/863187
Change-Id: I43c41103672de99a928807fe69fe3ee8a0274ec7

commit_message:
Disable setuptools auto discovery

To avoid the following error during installation.

sdist build error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in
a flat-layout.

Also, this change updates the following items to unblock CI.
- Declare the queue key at the top-level according to the recent change
  in zuul.
- Make c9s unit test job non-voting temporally. The job now
  consistently fails because of outdated package versions in gem spec.
- Migrate TripleO job from CentOS 8 Stream to CentOS Stream 9, because
  current master no longer supports CentOS 8 Stream.
- Pin mocha to <2.0.0 because 2.0.0 breaks unit tests in Ubuntu Focal.

Change-Id: I5144d738f53d127a4d306a47777e381873672d56

commit_message:
Use playbook variable in playbook task

We define a variable for the cli-config-download.yaml but don't
currently use it when invoking the run_ansible_playbook() method.
This change is minor and just ensures the run_ansible_playbook
function uses the already defined variable as well.

Change-Id: I9be98617e46547069e95dfee9c48dd2d6f572658

This change removes the ignore on F841 Flake8 errors.
https://www.flake8rules.com/rules/F841.html

Change-Id: I58c233485f3a01bb4d605194e38dd008f4c132fe

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-23 19:05:19.000000000', 'message': 'Check subnet overlapping after add router interface

When simultaneous attempts are made to add an interface
to the same router including overlapping networks in cidrs,
both attempts are successful. There is a check to avoid this
overlap but is performed when creating the network interface
and it is done over the ports already attached to the router,
so at this moment the check is not able to detect the
overlapping. Furthermore, the create_port operation over the
ML2 plugin  must be executed in isolated transactions, so
trying to control the execution context or adding additional
steps to the transaction is not feasible.

This patch checks once the RouterPort is created on the
neutron database if there is more than one overlapping port,
triggering in that case the exception that will remove the
second of the added ports.

Closes-Bug: #1987666
Change-Id: I7cec8b53e72e7abf34012906e6adfecf079525af
'}, {'created': '2022-09-26 09:55:35.000000000', 'message': 'Check subnet overlapping after add router interface

so at this moment the check is not able to detect the
overlapping. Furthermore, the create_port operation over the
ML2 plugin  must be executed in isolated transactions, so
trying to control the execution context or adding additional
steps to the transaction is not feasible.

This patch checks once the RouterPort is created on the
neutron database if there is more than one overlapping port,
triggering in that case the exception that will remove the
the culprit of overlapping.

Closes-Bug: #1987666
Change-Id: I7cec8b53e72e7abf34012906e6adfecf079525af

commit_message:
Check subnet overlapping after add router interface

When simultaneous attempts are made to add an interface
to the same router including overlapping networks in cidrs,
both attempts are successful. There is a check to avoid this
overlap but is performed when creating the network interface
and it is done over the ports already attached to the router,
so at this moment the check is not able to detect the
overlapping. Furthermore, the create_port operation over the
ML2 plugin  must be executed in isolated transactions, so
trying to control the execution context or adding additional
steps to the transaction is not feasible.

This patch checks once the RouterPort is created on the
neutron database if there is more than one overlapping port,
triggering in that case the exception that will remove the
the culprit of overlapping.

Closes-Bug: #1987666
Change-Id: I7cec8b53e72e7abf34012906e6adfecf079525af

commit_message:
Replace deprecated deployed-neutron-port.yaml

The deployed-neutron-port.yaml file was already deprecated in favor of
the new deployed(_vip)_port.j2 template.

This change also replaces the port_from_pool.j2 template by the same
deployed_vip_port.j2 so that we use the same implementation for all
vip management in overcloud, undercloud and standalone.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862970
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862974
Change-Id: Ic374c4d772bcecb0eca35db184cad25bc00ba7e3

commit_message:
HPE: Cinder driver for HPE XP storage FC and iSCSI arrays

This patch adds cinder driver for HPE XP storage FC and iSCSI
arrays.

Implements: blueprint hpe-xp-fc-iscsi-cinder-driver
Change-Id: I6e4ebcb9dc67e444157aaa85fcd0239817a79136

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-07 16:29:28.000000000', 'message': "Add tests for image location manipulation

This adds tests for the currently untested locations support in
images. A feature must be enabled for this to work, so a feature
flag is added to control it.

There is something in glance that must be enabled to allow https
URLs which is not working, so I'm using neverssl.com as a temporary
measure, but that should be fixed.

Change-Id: I779c959096b3aa9cc3d0fbf1e3c506a22d0a49fb
"}, {'created': '2022-10-07 18:08:31.000000000', 'message': "Add tests for image location manipulation

commit_message:
Add tests for image location manipulation

This adds tests for the currently untested locations support in
images. A feature must be enabled for this to work, so a feature
flag is added to control it.

Change-Id: I779c959096b3aa9cc3d0fbf1e3c506a22d0a49fb

commit_message:
[RBAC] Return 404 if share is inaccessible

When a user is prevented from listing a non-public
share, the API service would return a 403 Forbidden.
This isn't consistent with the API SIG's guidance
on resources restricted by virtue of RBAC policy since
users with malicious intent may use the signal to
mean that the resource exists.

Depends-On: I27fdd7dfffeb15965b66dbb3f6b1568c11ff9ad4
Change-Id: I7e05dcb343c932cc7fec8d395919053d0a1801ce
Closes-Bug: #1901210
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6303741be2394de9301f03f28f7ad20216aad7f6)
(cherry picked from commit 078bc4300a93e61c22b4958d87e034a707a700a1)
(cherry picked from commit dfb4e7ee93d4893fab19e6bf4f989483ef3bef6f)
(cherry picked from commit 5b8b7b19fd3cda9e2b3f573cdd9e704d1cca8cb0)
(cherry picked from commit 2e420aa5b7523e6c37c16baac18843fee2f15b57)
